jobs.title: Elementary K-5 Teacher Openings for the 26-27 school year (Full and Part Time)
jobs.status: Full Time and Part Time(please indicate on application if you are ONLY interested in Part Time positions)The salary for this position is assigned to the TT Salary Schedule.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkTT Salary Schedule.WCSD will recognize no more than thirteen full time, complete years of previous teaching experience when placing on the TT Salary Schedule. To estimate possible step placement on the TT Salary Schedule, select following linkTT Step Placement Calculator.Minimum Requirements:Active Utah Early ChildhoodorElementary Teaching License. ESL Endorsement beneficial but not required.For additional information regarding video interview eligibility, deadlines, and dates, please select the following linkElementary K-5 Information.Be sure to check your email(including spam folder) because communication will be done primarily via email, using the email address of your online application account.Attachment(s):Elementary Teacher.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version

jobs.title: Substitute Bus Driver Trainee
jobs.status: On-Call/As NeededMinimum QualificationsMinimum age of 21 years.Have no more than 100 points recorded on past driving record.  No more than two at-fault accidents, two citations, or a combination of one at-fault accident and one citation, in a 24 month period.Hold and maintain a Utah Commercial Drivers License.  Driver Training will be provided if candidate needs to obtain the Utah Commercial Drivers License.The salary for this position is assigned to the BD Salary ScheduleAFTER completion of training.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkBD Salary Schedule.APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO ATTACH/UPLOAD A COPY OF THEIR CURRENT DRIVING RECORD WITH THE APPLICATIONA copy of the driving record can be obtained from the Department of Motor Vehicles.Attachment(s):Bus Driver & Sub Bus Driver.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version

jobs.title: Head Cheer Coach (no teaching assignment)
jobs.description: This Head Cheer coaching assignment is for the 2026-2027 school year with no expectation of a teaching assignment.WCSD coaches are required to meet all UHSAA certification requirementspriorto starting assignment and are required to maintain certifications during duration of employment.If any additional questions, applicants can contact the Athletic Director, Gabi Hasenbeck at gabi.hasenbeck@washk12.org.A stipend will be provided for this assignment.

jobs.title: Head Cheer Coach (no teaching assignment)
jobs.description: This coaching assignment is for the 2026-2027 school year with no expectation of a teaching assignment.WCSD coaches are required to meet all UHSAA certification requirementspriorto starting assignment and are required to maintain certifications during duration of employment.If any additional questions, applicants can contact the Athletic Director, Dustin Drake, at dustin.drake@washk12.org.A stipend will be provided for this assignment.

jobs.title: Registered Behavior Technician
jobs.status: Part Time, 27.5 hours per weekMinimum Requirements:EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEAssociate's degreeor48 semester hours from an accredited college/universityorpassing results on an approved Paraprofessional Assessment.Consideration will be given to individuals with equivalent work experience specific to working with students with emotional/behavioral disabilities.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONSMust have a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Certification issued by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB).Will be required to complete the following training within 12 months of contract start date:WCSD Intensive Behavior Intervention (IBI) Training Level IWCSD Intensive Behavior Intervention (IBI) Training Level IIThe salary for this position is $28.59 per hour.Attachment(s):Registered Behavior Technician.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version

jobs.title: Substitute Bus Attendant
jobs.status: On-Call/As Needed BasisMinimum Requirements:High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to work effectively with individuals with disabilities.  Ability to learn tasks quickly and work with minimum supervision.  Ability to learn and implement emergency procedures associated with bus.  Previous experience working with individuals with disabilities preferred.The salary for this position is assigned to Level 2 of the SC Salary Schedule.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkSC Salary Schedule.Attachment(s):Bus Attendant.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version
